revision:
Trigonometric identities

  2. In \(\triangle\) ABC, right-angled at B , we have \(AB^2 + BC^2 = AC^2\)Dividing by \(AC^2\) we get::
    • \( cos^2A + sin^2A = 1\)for 0\(^\circ < A < \)90\(^\circ\)
    • \(sec^2A - tan^2A= 1\) for 0\(^\circ < A <\)90\(^\circ\)
    • \(cosec^2A - cot^2A = 1\) for 0\(^\circ < A < \) 90\(^\circ\)
  3. Note that cosec A and cot A are not defined for A = 0\(^\circ\). Therefore unlike other two identities \(cosec^2A - cot^2A = 1\) is Not True for A = 0\(^\circ\)
